reasoning: Aggregate BOTEC estimate for all birth defects. WHO estimates ~3.3% of births have major congenital anomalies (globally ~130M births/year × 0.033 ÷ 130M × 100k = ~2500 per 100k births). Extremely heterogeneous category including cardiac defects, neural tube defects, chromosomal abnormalities, limb malformations, etc. Low confidence due to vast heterogeneity.
source: WHO. Congenital anomalies fact sheet (2005 estimates)
